structure.unit: Crimes, Punishments And Proceedingsin Criminal Cases
Rights Of Persons Accused Of Crime

law.catch_line: Acquittal On Defective Pleadings; Subsequent Indictment
law.text: If a person has been acquitted by reason of a variance between the indictment or complaint and the proof, or by reason of a defect of form or substance in the indictment or complaint, he may be again arraigned, tried and convicted for the same crime on a new indictment or complaint, notwithstanding such former acquittal.
